snippet: A Fort Lee, N.J., man pleaded guilty to trying to sell weapons believed to be tied to one of Saddam Hussein’s sons.
abstract: Howard Blumenthal of Fort Lee, NJ, is fined $5,000 after pleading guilty to trying to sell smuggled firearms believed to have been owned by members of Saddam Hussein’s family; faces up to five years in prison.
lead_paragraph: A Fort Lee, N.J., man pleaded guilty to trying to sell weapons believed to be tied to one of Saddam Hussein’s sons.

headline.main: Fine in Case Tied to Hussein’s Guns
headline.print_headline: Fine in Case Tied to Hussein’s Guns
